item.title: Surprises and Yawns in Productivity Report
item.description: In a story out of Geneva, today, the United Nations reports that US workers are the most productive in the world, both hourly and annually. That’s no surprise, except to Democrats who like to paint Americans as the scum of the earth. The hours that we work are a bit off-putting, though. The U.S. employee put in an average 1,804 hours of work in 2006, the report said. That compared with 1,407.
